intro: Humboltia reichenbachiana, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Humboltia reichenbachiana is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
